💛 @Matthewlud
Free Presets! 👇🏻

posts.caption:
Pull up a seat at my Thanksgivjng table, friend. There's a new blog post up on Local Milk for Thanksgivjng! It has some decidedly NOT fall colored table inspiration (orange was never my thing), and a recipe for my new favorite holiday recipe / all the time party starter / breakfast bowl topper: Jammy Eggs with Homemade Kewpie Mayo & Furikake! Click the link in profile to join my table & steal my recipe while you're there!
💫
Gratitude is the name of the game this week (and every week around here), and I've been thinking a lot about the different ways in which we can let gratitude escape us, in the good times and the bad. Because as any sensible person knows whether you have a million dollar business or you're just barely scraping by you are equally capable of being perfectly miserable or perfectly happy in either scenario.
🎁
When we have plenty—good health, loving relationships, time & money—we run the risk of taking it all for granted. Of falling prey to the voices in the world (and they are legion) that demand we want more, more, more. Which is why even in the good seasons of life, it's critical we practice gratitude.
🌩
And in the stormy seasons, it's easy to be blinded by the areas that are going wrong. But even in death, in illness, and in loss, we have the choice to choose hope & joy. To choose gratitude. To change the negative tapes playing in our head. Gratitude is always there for the taking. And it will transform your entire world.
🌈
Today, I'm grateful for my healthy, happy beautiful Eulalie. A working marriage with @matthewlud (like a working farm...this marriage doesn't just sit there looking pretty...it's real, beautiful work). A career I love and the ability to work and travel at the same time. And YOU, my friend. This whole thing would be nothing without you. Head over to the link in profile to read the whole blog post, see my table, and get the recipe! And let me me know in the comments: What are you grateful for? If it's a person tag them to let them know! #livemoremagic #localmilkgathering •

On today's @rawmilkpodcast episode I'm talking about my LEAST favorite 4 letter F word...
🙀
FEAR. Namely how to get over fear and finally START something. That's right! The @rawmilkpodcast is back in action. Just click the link in profile to listen to the latest episode and head over to the @rawmilkpodcast feed for daily inspiration and motivation to make your dreams (like, for instance, calling your bedroom your office! 😬) a reality!
✨
Through the bumps & bruises to our heart during the normal course of life we develop fears that don't serve us. Fears based on false beliefs. I chose today's topic because I know exactly what that feels like.
🙈
After a 4 month break, I became intimately acquainted with the fear of starting again. Negative thoughts swirl. So you procrastinate on starting that business, that blog, that YouTube channel, that Etsy store, that podcast...You make excuses. And you never start. You don't try because if you don't try you can't fail. Many brilliant people never break past this wall.
⚡️
The difference between people who make it and people who don't is not whether they fail or not. People who make it fail MORE than people who don't. Because they step out in fear, into the unknown, and try. And get up and try again.
✨
And that's what it is to be brave. You don't expect fear to go away entirely. But you jump anyway. And in today's episode I'll teach you how. If you love the episode, share some love in the review section on iTunes and follow @rawmilkpodcast here on Instagram to help us climb the charts after my sabbatical! I do the podcast weekly for 100% free and your reviews, likes, and comments are what keep us going! If I know I'm helping people, that's all the motivation I need! So tune in and join me in saying my favorite four letter F word (you can guess that one!) to my least favorite four letter F word, fear! 😂 #ff •

Currently these Japan inspired Homemade Kewpie & Furikake "Deviled" Jammy Eggs for Thanksgiving part II at my in-laws! Find the recipe on the blog!
🍳
Instead of scooping the yolks out and piping them back in you just dollop super umami Kewpie inspired mayo on top of Jammy 8 minute eggs & sprinkle with scallions and furikake. Soooo much easier. And ridiculously good. We love these on top of rice, savory porridge, or yogurt bowl for brekkie.
💫
Go steal my recipe (along with my homemade kewpie and furikake recipes!) via the link in profile on the Local Milk blog! And don't forget to enter the giveaway for a free pack of my new Lightroom presets for mobile and desktop, The Instagram Collection! It closes Monday! See my previous post for details! And happy holiday weekend...may you all be doing a whole lot of nothing & have leftovers for dayyyzzz.

Hooray! The Local Milk blog is back up and running after some 🙀 technical difficulties just in time for Thanksgiving! Click the link in profile for some food, travel, and slow living inspiration!
🍳
You can find all your favorite Local Milk recipes (I make the cornbread and biscuit stuffing—an heirloom recipe from my grandmother—from scratch every year!) You can also find my favorite pies, a ricotta cheesecake to mix things up, and a Gruyere stuffed pumpkin that works as an awesome vegetarian alternative to the turkey as a show stopping centerpiece! And sooo much more!
🥘
Click the link in profile to binge on our recipe archives as you plan your menus and stay tuned for some new table and recipe inspiration! So psyched to have the site back up and running! What is the one dish you can live without on Thanksgiving? I think for me it might be Dad's deviled eggs.

"The only way out is in." My mantra today. A quote from this morning's yoga practice. Sometimes the jungle and the secret garden are one and the same. The only thing to change is your eyes, and to change your eyes you have to go inside yourself. What I hope for you today...
•
I hope your body serves you. Whether it's walking, stretching, or simply being in less pain than the day before, I hope you and your body are in a conversation. Lean into the challenge, the sweat, the pain. Listen. Your body is where the mind begins.
•
I hope you have the simple pleasure of tasting something that nourishes your body or soul and brings you pleasure. A bright smoothie. A bowl of lentils. A perfectly cooked egg. A clean, clear glass of water. Campari. Cheese pizza. Whatever. I hope it tastes good and you can care that it does. And that it feeds your cells or lifts your spirit or both.
•
And I hope you'll remember you don't have to be perfect to be beautiful. I don't know about you, but nothing and no one I've ever loved deeply was perfect. They were always pretty damn interesting though. Remember that in different seasons of life the same scene can fill you with joy or sadness. My hope for you today is that you'll see the light, be the light, laugh like at hell at my banalities and feel better and think "those leaves look nice and glow." What is your mantra today? #livemoremagic •
•
•
Ps. The mobile presets are coming but we wanted to make them perfect! SO many of you have asked (and yes this was edited with them!)....hang tight and they'll be the best they can be! 😘
•

#calmversation #theartofslowliving #chasinglight

Do you want to know what my number one priority in raising this little fairy angel is?
✨
It's that she be brave. To be kind in this world, we must first be brave. That she know the difference between healthy fear and bad fear. That she have a bright inner North Star. I want her to understand that in life some cliffs should not be jumped off of because there are rocks below. And that from other cliffs you can dive into the glittering, aqua sea, no matter how scary it may seem when you're looking down.
💫
On the latest episode of my show, the @rawmilkpodcast (follow along over there for daily motivation and inspiration in achieving your creative dreams!) that's what I'm talking about: How to Overcome Fear and Start. Whether it's a blog, an online business, a YouTube channel, an Instagram account, or a podcast...The first step is the leap. Everything afterwards becomes easier.
🌈
Click the link in profile to listen...and binge out on the other 15 episodes if you haven't listened before! It's a great way to pass the time during your holiday travels and hopefully it will give you the tools and motivation to tell your fear to take the backseat so you can bravely step out and pursue your dreams without letting a bunch of false beliefs in your way!
👇🏻
Let me know in the comments what else you'd like to hear on the show! I'm an open book on all things creative business, making money as a creative (and not needing to apologize for it!), online & social media marketing, and more!

Did you know that before @matthewlud was a rockstar at coffee, beer, and wine he was just a rockstar? Like the music kind.
🔥
He's been a musician his whole life but it's been a decade since he's released anything...until now! Go follow @merefellows now...his new music project!
🙌🏻
He just released his first single "On the Run"on @spotify and @itunes and pretty much everywhere else you could listen to music online. He says the song isn't about us but I can't help but feel like for a nomadic family like ours "On the Run" feels pretty apropos! Go give it a listen and give him some love & support!
🙏🏻
Cause he certainly gives Eula and I all the love & support he's got. Oh, and he's really freaking good. Listening to him sing was one of the many things that made me fall in love with him! ☺️ •

Double tap if you love a good jammy egg yolk! New Recipe! // Jammy "Deviled" Eggs with Homemade Kewpie (Japanese style mayo) & Homemade Furikake! Click the link in profile so you can make these a part of your Thanksgivjng (or any day!) table.
😳
Yes, you read that right. Not only is a fresh, new episode of the @rawmilkpodcast out today...there's a brand new Thanksgivjng post up on Local Milk! And you can find it all through that little link in bio. The post includes some romantic, rustic table inspiration for people who prefer pink to orange, and the recipe for one of the most delicious things I've ever put in my mouth: these eggs.
🥚
Think of these as deviled eggs but a heck of a lot easier, more "ouef mayo", but with Japanese inspired flavors. This recipe basically mashes together all of my culinary inspirations: the south, France, and Japan. And it's easy as heck and dope AF.
🍳
And don't limit these babies to your holiday table. These are a great snack with a bottle of natural wine, and they're great on a bowl of steamed rice or savory porridge for brekkie! #eatmoremagic
